Question: How to display items in a widget with a next button: :I have a a list of items i want to display inside of a widget. I was told that i should have a next button on the widget to show each item. The question is i need to know how this works..Will each item be loaded as the user hits next?I want the items to all load at once, and then the user be able to click through them with the next button..Could some one give me greater detials on this? or an example or tutorial would be great.ThanksEDIT:SO i have a list of Item Titles, and Some info about them loaded from html into an ArrayList.What i want to do is display the items in a wigdet.ListView is not allowed in any os older then 3.0.What is or how is the best way to get around this to display the items?
Please using this api: List.get.
Answer: ASSISTANT:
response:
<<<api>>>: List.get
<<<code>>>: List<Item> itemList = new ArrayList<>();
// Load item titles and info from HTML into itemList
// ...
itemDisplayWidget = findViewById(R.id.item_display_widget);
itemListView = findViewById(R.id.item_list_view);
itemAdapter = new ItemAdapter(itemList);
itemListView.setAdapter(itemAdapter);
itemDisplayWidget.setVisibility(View.GONE);
itemListView.setVisibility(View.VISIBLE);
<<<explanation>>>: To display the items in a ListView, you can use the ListView widget and set an adapter to it. In this example, the itemList is populated with the item titles and info from HTML, and an ItemAdapter is created to display the items in the ListView. The visibility of the itemDisplayWidget is set to GONE, and the visibility of the itemListView is set to VISIBLE, so that the items are displayed in the ListView and the itemDisplayWidget is hidden.
